objectives: Understand complex texts about digital addiction
Identify main arguments and supporting details

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to digital addiction
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to digital addiction

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about digital addiction
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about digital addiction
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about digital addiction

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Open space allowing movement and hands-on activities

warm_up.description: Students move around and interact physically related to digital addiction
warm_up.materials: Space for movement, props if needed

main_activities.description: Students receive information about digital addiction through kinesthetic modality
Students practice language related to digital addiction using kinesthetic approach
Students produce original content about digital addiction demonstrating basic thinking

discussion_prompts: What do you know about digital addiction?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for digital addiction
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to digital addiction

homework_options.required: Core assignment at basic level using kinesthetic approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about digital addiction
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
